alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL BIG HORN AND SOUTHERN ROSEBUD COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Busby, or 27 miles southeast of Hardin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Travel on Highway 212 may be impacted by strong and sudden wind gusts. Locations impacted include... Lame Deer, Busby, Muddy Cluster, Birney Village, and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
